image.altText: damaged overhead powerlines

props.synopsis: Lengthy delays to a return of power for tens of thousands of Tasmanians during recent wild weather will be the topic of an independent review, as the state looks to learn from response shortcomings.

title.children: Tasmanians left with extended power outage to vent frustrations as independent inquiry into response announced

image.altText: A graphic depicting an American flag that has been torn in half, with a shadow hanging over it.

props.synopsis: Of all the schisms that cleave contemporary America, few are more stark than the divide between those who consider themselves to be victims of US history and those who fear they will be casualties of its future.

title.children: America is on the verge of something fateful, but it cannot escape history

image.altText: A chair lift at the bottom of a set of household stairs.

props.synopsis: Older Australians being cared for at home will be able to apply for a new $25,000 palliative support payment when they have three months of life left under the government's aged care overhaul.

title.children: A new $25,000 support payment seeks to make it easier for people to die at home

image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: In a suburb in Hobart's outskirts, photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: a police forensic officer inspect a tree branch after it struck woman killing her in liverpool

props.synopsis: The woman, believed to be in her 60s, was hit on Castlereagh Street in Liverpool about 1pm. She was treated by paramedics but died at the scene.

title.children: Woman dies after being hit by a falling tree branch in Sydney' south-west as wild winds sweep across NSW

image.altText: A screenshot of a road map showing a creek near a road

props.synopsis: Two people are dead and another is in hospital in a serious but stable condition after a car accident near Mungindi.

title.children: Two people die after car crashes into creek near NSW-Queensland border

image.altText: Multiple zip-lock bags with labels and white powder.

props.synopsis: Tasmania police have seized a large sum of cash believed to be the proceeds of crime, along with a "significant quantity" of drugs in a targeted operation in the state's north-west.

title.children: Two men facing charges as Tasmania police seize half a kilo of 'ice', $100,000 cash

image.altText: An aboriginal man looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Brian never had cake on his birthday as a child, just "hidings" every other day. He is one of many Indigenous people providing testimony to Queensland's Truth-Telling and Healing Inquiry.

title.children: 'What's a mother?': The story of the boy who never had a birthday cake

image.altText: Rodney Croome arrested in 1988

props.synopsis: A nation-first financial redress scheme has passed Tasmania's parliament for people convicted under past laws against homosexuality and cross-dressing.

title.children: 'It's only just': Tasmania's new laws to allow victims of 'cross-dressing' compensation for past convictions

image.altText: snow speckled mountain can be seen behind buildings at elizabeth pier in hobart tasmania

props.synopsis: Spring's infamous variability will be on full display this weekend, delivering a blast of cold Antarctic air and potentially the coldest September weather in decades.

title.children: Antarctic air mass to deliver weekend snow, hail and thunder to eastern Australia

image.altText: Ken Hinkley speaking to Hawthorn players after AFL semifinal.

props.synopsis: The AFL comes down hard on Port Adelaide following Power coach Ken Hinkley's heated exchange with Hawthorn players following Friday night's semifinal.

title.children: AFL fines Power $20,000 after Hinkley's confrontation with Hawks

image.altText: Jane Hume at senate estimates

props.synopsis: The Coalition has confirmed it will walk away entirely from the key recommendation of an independent review of the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title.children: Coalition walks back in-principle support for restructuring RBA board

image.altText: A graphic showing a puppeteer controlling icons of Facebook, TikTok and Instagram.

props.synopsis: The government's attempts to crackdown on misinformation online will make it powerful enemies in Silicon Valley. Is it ready for the fight?

title.children: Can the government win against Silicon Valley's billionaires?

image.altText: Storm debris covers Stanwell Park beach

props.synopsis: There are growing signs Australia's most impactful climate driver, La Niña, will develop during the coming months.

title.children: Latest modelling tips fourth La Niña for Australia in five years before year's end

image.altText: A man in a blue suit stands in front of a podium, in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: As Tasmania's public sector workers admonish the government's belt tightening, the treasurer has not ruled out selling state-owned assets to help balance the books.

title.children: 'We'd be open to an individual asset being considered': Tasmania's treasurer may look to sell public assets to temper ballooning debt

image.altText: Three cars park on a country road, in front of plumes of smoke emerging from grass.

props.synopsis: The Houthi rebels who control northern Yemen have claimed responsibility for firing a missile into central Israel on Sunday. Air raid sirens sounded across the region but the missile hit an unpopulated area and caused no injuries.

title.children: Yemen's Houthi rebels fire missile into central Israel

image.altText: A Sudanese refugee stands in front of rows of people sitting on the ground in Chad.

props.synopsis: Death, displacement, famine, and the collapse of most government and public infrastructure -- that's been the experience of the ongoing civil war in Sudan.

title.children: With 10 million displaced, some call it the forgotten war. These numbers explain the conflict in Sudan

image.altText: A moustached middle-aged South American man thanks a crowd as he wears a red, yellow and blue starred jacket

props.synopsis: The US government denied claims of a plot to overthrow the Venezuelan government after a member of the US military was confirmed to be detained.

title.children: Venezuela arrests Spanish and US citizens accused of plot to kill president Maduro

image.altText: People waiting at a train station.

props.synopsis: Queensland will benefit from cheaper public transport permanently after the "huge success" of a trial of 50 cent fares, with the government and LNP promising to keep the fares in place.

title.children: QLD government and LNP promise to keep lower fares as figures show surge in public transport use

image.altText: A birds eye view of the river coming down

props.synopsis: The mesmerising transformation of parched sand giving way to the rush of fresh, flowing water has people across a vast outback region in awe as it carves a path from the bush to the sea.

title.children: Outback in awe as river's spectacular run mesmerises locals

props.synopsis: Flewnt and Inkabee were lauded for their 'mesmerising' performance on America's Got Talent. But a social media photo prompted a very different reaction in Australia.

title.children: A Perth father and son hip-hop duo shone on America's Got Talent. Then came the online trolls

image.altText: A woman wearing a cap holdings a long brown basket on her back while she picks green leaves.

props.synopsis: Sri Lanka's tea industry grapples with a steep wage hike, but some estate owners embrace new approaches to balance worker welfare and productivity in a bid to save the sector.

title.children: Sri Lanka supplies most of Australia's tea, but its industry is now at a crossroad

image.altText: A redheaded man with a beard

props.synopsis: As Harry turns 40, he has not only transitioned from the cheeky spare into a husband and father, he has increasingly aligned himself with Diana's family over the House of Windsor.

title.children: 'He feels at home with the Spencers': Why Harry has aligned with Diana's fiery family

image.altText: Ben Carroll talking to the government.

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered to lift its funding share for public schools, but Victoria has rejected the offer in a situation the state's education minister has described as "difficult".

title.children: Victoria rejects federal government school funding offer, creating a 'difficult' stalemate

image.altText: A house destroyed by fire.

props.synopsis: A house fire in Adelaide's north-east claims the life of a 74-year-old man, who was found unconscious inside the home but could not be revived, emergency services say.

title.children: 74yo man dies in house fire at Gilles Plains, after woman injured in separate blaze sparked by cigarettes

image.altText: Laura Loomer in focus in the foreground; Donald Trump blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: Laura Loomer joined US presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign trial this week, attending his presidential debate against Kamala Harris and joining him for a 9/11 memorial service.

title.children: Who is Laura Loomer, the far-right activist Republicans fear is influencing Donald Trump with 'garbage' tactics?

image.altText: A crowd of women hold signs with slogans in French, one of which has a drawing of Gisele Pelicot

props.synopsis: Thousands of protesters take to the streets across France to demand an end to rape and to support the main plaintiff in a mass sexual assault trial that has shocked the country.

title.children: Thousands protest against rape culture in France amid Pelicot trial

image.altText: Reuben Garrick of the Sea Eagles fights with Reed Mahoney of the Bulldogs

props.synopsis: The Manly Sea Eagles have progressed through to the NRL semifinals, coming from behind to defeat the Canterbury Bulldogs 24-22.

title.children: Manly come back to stun 'self destructing' Bulldogs in elimination final thriller

image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: "The Bruce" is being labelled a national disgrace, pock-marked with dangerous potholes and signposted with memorials to people who have died on the notorious road.

title.children: The national highway that some drivers say is more like a 'goat track' — with deadly consequences

image.altText: Police outside a nightclub

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries following an alleged attack at a 24-hour nightclub.

title.children: Police hunt for attackers after alleged stabbing at Melbourne's Revolver Upstairs

image.altText: An illustration of a well-dressed 18th century man with words in the background

props.synopsis: Colonial Australian John Lang lived a life of dramatic highs and lows, and he may have been the first Australian novelist. He is celebrated in India, but still largely unknown on our shores.

title.children: This novel has murky origins. It could have a momentous place in Australian history

image.altText: Baby pygmy hippo with its mouth open

props.synopsis: A Thai zoo has been forced to limit crowds visiting viral online sensation Moo Deng after videos show mistreatment of the pygmy hippo.

title.children: Baby pygmy hippo Moo Deng becomes overnight celebrity. But officials warn about cruel visitor behaviour

image.altText: A family holds a cheetah pup.

props.synopsis: The fly-in, fly-out mine worker's travel insurance had expired when the crash left him fighting for life as his family scrambled to cover expenses and get him home. And that's a cautionary tale for Australians overseas, says a medical repatriation expert.

title.children: Australian car crash victim flown to Perth for surgery after months in a Thai hospital

image.altText: A man creating street art in an alleyway

props.synopsis: With its laneways a hotspot for tourists, Melbourne City Council walks a fine line of encouraging the street art scene while keeping the taggers to a minimum.

title.children: Is it art or is it a crime? These are the rules of street art in Australia's graffiti capital
